intro: Berinia heterotricha, commonly known as the hairy berinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
